intro: Delphinastrum exaltatum, commonly known as the tall milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically oval-shaped with serrated edges. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes other milkweeds known for their milky sap. Delphinastrum exaltatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
